title: Advanced Discourse Markers
description: Use high-level connectors and transitions to organize ideas coherently in speech and writing.

title: Complex Inversion Structures
description: Master inversion in conditionals, comparisons and emphasis: 'Had I known...', 'So did he...'.

title: Reduced Relative Clauses
description: Shorten clauses for fluency and conciseness: 'The man living next door...' instead of 'who lives...'.

title: Mixed Time Structures
description: Use multiple tenses in one sentence to express complex timelines or logic.

title: Embedded Questions
description: Form polite, indirect, or formal questions: 'Do you know where he went?'

title: Emphatic Structures
description: Use patterns like 'What I want is...', 'All I need is...' for stylistic emphasis.

title: Advanced Passive Constructions
description: Use causative and complex passive forms: 'He is said to have...', 'She had the car repaired'.

title: Hedging Language
description: Soften statements or express uncertainty: 'It seems that...', 'might be', 'could suggest'.

title: Style Shifting
description: Adapt tone and register based on audience, context or purpose.

title: Nominalisation and Textual Cohesion
description: Increase formality and coherence in academic or formal writing.
